text: hi I'm Lola and I'm the model from the
Dove advert people seem to think the
advert is racist because I am shown to
be removing my top and turning into a
white woman as a dark-skinned black
woman I've heard countless times through
society and my peers that there is a
lighter or white standard of beauty that
I don't have to have the opportunity to
show that I do feel beautiful and I am
valued in media was extremely exciting
for me so for it to come out and be
taken out of context and and then kind
of spiral into a global controversy was
it was really overwhelming and quite
upsetting as well I think the full TV ad
does a much better job of expressing
what the campaign message was the
Facebook ad was really just meant to be
something a bit more fun a slightly
different creative concept the message
is that we you know we're all different
and we look different but the product is
the same and it works on all of us I'm
not wholeheartedly defending dove
preparing for this sort of
misinterpretation is something that dove
could have anticipated they immediately
issued an apology if dove had had
defended their creative vision and
defended their choice sees me as a
dark-skinned woman defended their
reasoning for using me first
for whatever reason it could have put a
different type of narrative into into
play
you
